data.title: Thai foreign minister visiting South Australia
data.description: Bilateral cooperation has been highlighted in the fields of agricultural technology, alternative energy and education during a visit by Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa to Adelaide, the capital of South Australia.

data.title: Thai-German rail pact renewed
data.description: Thailand and Germany have renewed an agreement on  rail development , a long-term commitment to address several key problems with an efficient and environmentally friendly rail transport system.

data.title: 14-year-old fatally stabbed by teen friend in Sattahip
data.description: CHON BURI - A 14-year-old Thai-Australian schoolboy was  stabbed to death  by his friend at the entrance of a housing estate in Sattahip district on Tuesday night. The teen attacker was subsequently arrested.

data.title: Wildly drunk tourist charged with assaulting police
data.description: PHUKET – A Belarusian tourist faces charges after allegedly attacking police and security guards while extremely intoxicated - and his wife and children are returning home without him.

data.title: Tourist killed by wild elephant in Phu Kradueng park
data.description: A tourist was killed by a wild elephant in Phu Krabueng National Park on Tuesday, and alarmed officials declared some areas closed to visitors.

data.title: Bail upheld for Thai MP appealing lese-majeste conviction
data.description: Rukchanok Srinork , a People’s Party MP who is appealing convictions for  lese-majeste  and computer crime, on Wednesday survived an attempt to have her  bail  revoked.

data.title: Patient dies after brutal treatment by hospital staff
data.description: SI SA KET - A 31-year-old patient suffering from alcohol withdrawal died after allegedly being brutalised by staff at the hospital where he was being treated.

data.title: Pheu Thai's Prayuth, crusader against military coups
data.description: Pheu Thai Party list-MP Prayuth Siripanich has been in the limelight following his proposal to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, aiming to reduce the military

data.title: Pheu Thai's Prayuth, crusader against military coups
data.description: Pheu Thai Party list-MP Prayuth Siripanich has been in the limelight following his proposal to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, aiming to reduce the military

data.title: Ex-DPM Wissanu says skip charter referendum
data.description: The charter should be amended section by section to avoid having to conduct a referendum, as the focus should be on forming an assembly to redraft the constitution, according to legal experts.

data.title: Crusader against military coups
data.description: Pheu Thai Party list-MP Prayuth Siripanich has been in the limelight following his proposal to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, aiming to reduce the military

data.title: Ex-DPM says skip referendum
data.description: The charter should be amended section by section to avoid having to conduct a referendum, as the focus should be on forming an assembly to redraft the constitution, according to legal experts.

data.title: More parties oppose Pheu Thai’s anti-coup bill
data.description: The coalition-member  United Thai Nation  Party (UTN) and the opposition  Palang Pracharat  Party (PPRP) have expressed their objection to a  bill  drafted by an MP of the ruling  Pheu Thai  Party intended to prevent future  military coups .

data.title: 3 killed in armed rampage in Prachin Buri
data.description: PRACHIN BURI - Three people were killed and four others were injured when a man with a knife and a gun went on a rampage before being stabbed to death in Muang district on Tuesday afternoon.

data.title: Masseuse in ‘Ping Chayada’ case asks for fairness
data.description: A masseuse who was reported to have performed a neck-twisting procedure on a luk thung singer who later died has asked for fairness and a chance to tell her side of the story.

data.title: HPV vaccinations for schoolgirls stepped up
data.description: The Ministry of Public Health will start offering the first dose of  HPV  (Human papillomavirus virus) vaccine to prathom 5 (grade 5) schoolgirls on Dec 20 as protection against  cervical cancer .

data.title: Legal expert says Yingluck can’t avoid prosecution
data.description: Former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra , who fled the country seven years ago, can return home whenever she wants as long as she is willing to face legal  prosecution , former deputy prime minister Wissanu Krea-ngam said on Tuesday.

data.title: Legal expert says Yingluck can’t avoid prosecution
data.description: Former prime minister  Yingluck Shinawatra , who fled the country seven years ago, can return home whenever she wants as long as she is willing to face legal  prosecution , former deputy prime minister Wissanu Krea-ngam said on Tuesday.

data.title: Dozens of complaints against Pheu Thai dismissed
data.description: The  Election Commission  (EC) says it has dismissed almost 50 complaints filed against the Pheu Thai  Party seeking its disbandment, leaving only six cases under investigation.

data.title: Zoo assures fans Moo Deng did not eat tissue paper
data.description: Khao Kheow Open Zoo has assured Moo Deng’s fans that a tourist did not drop the piece of tissue paper she was seen chewing on in her enclosure - a monkey did it.
